programme.title: Nash Bridges

programme.title: Nash Bridges

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nashs investigation into the murder of the Chief of Police puts him in conflict with the DEA.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash goes undercover in Las Vegas to track down the Chief of Police killer.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: A mad bomber forces Nash to choose between saving Cassidy or Joe.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nashs old flame Tamara is back and tangled up in an FBI investigation.

programme.title: Nash Bridges

programme.title: Nash Bridges

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Cassidy investigates a fraternitys members suspicious death.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash has to stop a bunch of wealthy slackers from killing each other for sport.

programme.title: Nash Bridges

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash tries to protect a TV reporter stalked by a murderous maniac.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Tony B needs Nashs help when he fakes his own death.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash and an AWOL Canadian Mountie battle bears and bad guys.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash has to prove Rachels innocence when she is framed for murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Johnny Gibbs, Lucas McCain's brother-in-law, visits the McCain ranch. Gibbs, a rodeo rider wanted by the law, begins stirring up trouble.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: New Orleans' underworld conspires to rub out administrator Colton right when Colton's sister Agatha finally arrives on a visit. Yancy expected a Boston battle-ax, but he's smitten with her charm and wit. Colton has a heavy workload, fending off crime czar Lance Carter, and wowing Agatha with his Reconstruction wizardry, while building a romantic blockade between her and Yancy.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Mr. Proctor, a friend of the Derringer family, is sent to New Orleans with a message from a former general in the Civil War. But before he is able to relay the message to Yancy, Mr. Proctor is assassinated, leaving Yancy to uncover the mystery behind the Confederate half dollar Mr. Proctor was carrying when he died.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Crooks target old prospector Cactus Charlie after he discovers their hidden stash of stolen gold.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: A railroad company draws suspicion when lines of barbed-wire fencing disappear from the ranches near its rail lines, calling the rightful owner of the land into question.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: Capt. Monastario tries to keep Don Alejandro (George J. Lewis) and Don Nacho Torres (Jan Arvan) from getting a fair trial.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: Capt. Monastario and Sgt. Garcia (Henry Calvin) come up with a secret plan they are sure will catch Zorro.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: Capt. Monastario attempts to discredit Zorro by hiring a criminal to impersonate him.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: Hoping to ruin Zorro's reputation, Monasterio dresses a prisoner as Zorro and has him commit a crime.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An embittered Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her cowardly husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, the scout stays on to help for a while and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: The Comancheros
programme.desc: After his partner is killed, aging Texas Ranger Jake Cutter (John Wayne) is assigned to capture gambler Paul Regret (Stuart Whitman), a condemned prisoner who managed to escape hanging, and return him to Louisiana to face his sentence. But once Cutter has him in custody, they encounter the Comancheros, a fierce band of outlaws providing guns and booze to the Comanches, and are forced to work together to stop them. When Regret proves his worth in the fight, Cutter begins to reevaluate his duties.

programme.title: Gun Glory
programme.desc: Life is anything but sweet when roaming gunfighter Tom Early (Stewart Granger) returns home. His wife has died, and his son (Steve Rowland) now barely speaks to him. Things aren't much different in town, where Early tangles with the posse of a cattle baron (James Gregory) who vows to run a herd of 20,000 roughshod through the settlers' land. Early must somewhat reluctantly play the role of defender, especially after a foolhardy plan by the local preacher (Chill Wills) goes awry.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Lt. Briggs breaks the treaty by chasing an Indian beyond the recognized border

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: A series of thefts are falsely attributed to the innocent Mingo False Faces

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Hawkeye has tracked outlaw Simon Girty to Morristown

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim is tricked into aiding a plot to assassinate President Jackson.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: When a renegade American, now a Mexican Army officer, plots to kill Bowie because he?s a friend of Sam Houston, Bowie is detained on pretext of lacking a passport to Texas.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim Bowie encounters a bear and must flee for his life, the event which inspired the first Bowie knife to be made.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim Bowie gives an arrogant Southern belle a lesson in manners and wins her sympathy for an impoverished immigrant family.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho meet up with Griffith's traveling show consisting of ex-sheriff Ben, his daughter and their trained elephant Mildred. Stokes and Shaddon are after a medallion in their possession.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho discover a wounded boy in an abandoned shack who says that outlaws killed his older brother.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho try to avenge an archaeologist who was murdered while on the verge of discovering the tomb of an important Aztec.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Ranch owners are in jeopardy of losing their land and businesses when newcomers threaten to take over, so Cisco does what he can to help the current owners.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: An attorney faces an ethical dilemma when defending a seemingly innocent man.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: A cold-blooded killer escapes when a man prevents a hanging.

programme.title: Gold of the Seven Saints
programme.desc: After discovering a fortune in gold nuggets, Shaun Garrett (Roger Moore) and his partner, Jim Rainbolt (Clint Walker), make their way toward the town of Seven Saints to redeem it for cash. Word of their find reaches bandit McCracken (Gene Evans), who comes after them. The men hide their treasure and fend off McCracken with the help of Doc Gates (Chill Wills), before escaping to recover at the ranch of Rainbolt's friend, Amos Gondora (Robert Middleton), waiting until they can retrieve the gold.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: An anthology series based on the novels of Zane Grey.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: A Southerner serving in the Union army has his loyalty questioned.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: A man is the victim of his own greed when he becomes a bounty hunter.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: A peddler outwits a gang of killers.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: After Sam Brewster's son gets shot in self defense by Deputy Charlie, only Curly Bill Brocius decides to stand with the sheriff when they meet Brewster's men at the outskirts of town.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Clay receives what turns out to be a bogus telegram after killing a cattle baron who forced a gunfight; the people from the rancher's hometown plan to execute Clay for murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A vengeful judge who believes Lucas was responsible for his son's death, kidnaps Mark McCain to revenge himself on Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A handsome Italian count arrives in North Fork. The town bully ridicules his manner of speech and dress and provokes the Count to challenge him to a duel.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A new bank opens and Banker Hamilton hires a slow-witted gunman to guard the safe. When some of the gunman's old outlaw friends arrive in town they propose he join them in robbing the bank.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark tries to play Cupid between Lucas and a pretty young stranger who arrives in North Fork, the girl's two older brothers accuse him of trifling with her affections and challenge him to fight them both.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates counterfeit money that's being passed throughout the French Quarter. His investigation brings him into contact with Lonesome Jackson, a miner who recently struck in rich & seeking a wife. The Treasury Department suspects Jackson because of the large bankroll he's carrying, but Yancy believes that the miner is being set up as a patsy by the real counterfeiters.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy assists in transporting a Presidential pardon intended to save a Southerner who sided with the Union army from an unjust death sentence. However, his delivery is derailed by army officer with vengeance in his heart who attempts to carry out the execution anyway. Now Yancy must find a way to ease the last vestiges of the Civil War before someone dies!

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat presides over a shooting contest and must confront a bully who cheats his way to first place.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat must convince the owners of a dangerous Colorado mine to halt work before an accident occurs.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: An adopted boy mistakenly believes that his outlaw father is a hero.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: As a prospector, the Lone Ranger seeks a criminal mastermind.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark's careless actions cause the death of a friend. Unable to accept the truth, he blames the rifle and runs away from home. Soon, he is faced with a tough decision.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Nils Swenson takes the marshal's place for a few days while Micah is away. To maintain peace, Nils insists that anyone coming into town must turn in their weapons.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A murder occurs at a railroad camp and a young Indian friend of Lucas' is accused of the killing. When Lucas tries to help the boy, he finds himself on trial.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark come upon Winslow Quince, a peddler whose wagon has broken down. They help him bring his wagon to North Fork for repair.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gridley Mau, the son of a man Lucas killed during an attempted robbery, comes to North Fork looking for revenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The first railroad train is coming to the new North Fork station. On board is a Japanese nobleman and his servant, visiting the West to learn about the United States.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Lucas run into Micah on the trail and help when the prisoner he is transporting injures his arm. Lucas' life is endangered when a snake crawls into his bed.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While Mark goes hunting for Old Spike, Lucas goes hunting for his mortal enemy. Lucas is thrown into jail to stop him from murdering his former friend.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is baffled when the marshal of a neighboring town refuses to hold a gambler who just attempted murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas, who blames his wife's death on his father-in-law, refuses to help the old man elude a gang of gunmen.

programme.desc: The lazy Jackman brothers mortgage has been foreclosed. Unfit for farming, they head to a nearby town. The family patriarch becomes marshal and deputizes his sons.

programme.desc: Mark and his girlfriend discover that an old hermit is very lonely. Old Tony invites them to lunch and lets them look for arrowheads on a remote part of his land.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.desc: As each lead turns cold in a gruesome murder case, Dr. G worries justice may never be served. As the autopsy draws to a end, Dr. G uncovers a shocking clue that may solve this crime.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must decide if she can perform a successful autopsy without the deceased's organs. As she ponders the decision, we are given a rare glimpse into a different side of Dr. G's job.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After suffering an apparent seizure, 37-year-old Ruben Delgado is found lifeless by his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In an unprecedented double autopsy, Dr. G is determined to find out who is accountable for these odd deaths and solve the mystery of a love triangle gone awry.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: All circumstances point to foul play in the case of a dead hunter and the police fear that a killer is on the loose. Dr. G must provide them with answers before there are more victims.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, a burn victim receives a rare treatment the doctors have never performed before.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A doctor treats three gunshot victims, a new doctor must perform emergency brain surgery and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: The ER becomes a dangerous place when smuggled drugs are found in a patient's belly.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A snake bite victim may die in the ER because life-saving anti-venom is in short supply.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Celebrations morph into medical mania after their special occasions land them in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen football player suffers a stroke; a doctor remembers his first major trauma in the 1970s; a doctor tries to figure out what causes a patient's abdominal pain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled through the skull with a crowbar, a woman has an internal worm infection and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A knifing victim suddenly starts seizing and his doctors can't treat him until they figure out the cause.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two seemingly unrelated gunshot wounds lead to a bizarre night in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen is bleeding internally from an ectopic pregnancy but denies ever having had sex.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man who's been smashed by a dumpster barely clings to life. A nun and a prostitute come into the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A newlywed's hand gets stuck in an appliance and a woman appears to only have blood flow to half of her brain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors use a robot operated by a specialist at another hospital to treat a seizing 7-year-old boy.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two well-dressed ladies are ready to hit the town but end up in the ER instead.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient comes in with progressing paralysis, a boy is crushed by an ATV and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER physician races to determine why a young woman is burning up from the inside out after a beach visit.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two skydivers are rushed in, a bride-to-be gets her finger stuck in a make-up jar and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An entire fraternity is plagued with blue urine, a pregnant woman is bitten by a spider and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Treatment of a young boy's broken leg turns into an investigation that may reveal child abuse.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man crashes his car into a cow. A woman has a stiletto heel jammed into her cheek.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three patients sneak their pets into the hospital, causing pandemonium in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A shooting victim is brought to the hospital. A Rottweiler gets loose in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A psychiatric patient has an extreme love of pudding. A patient may be allergic to his girlfriend.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A college student collapses in the ER, and doctors do hours of CPR, hoping she'll revive.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young woman in labor begs the ER doctor to keep her pregnancy and delivery a secret from her father.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: The ER becomes a dangerous place when smuggled drugs are found in a patient's belly.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A first hand look at individuals who didn't expect to become human shish kabobs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An urgent care physician must invent creative ways to save a choking child.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: When a man with a hand injury passes out from abdominal pain, tests lead to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors struggle to save a young man brought to the ER frozen and pulseless.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient appears to be hallucinating and sends the ER staff on a wild-goose chase around the hospital.

programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bons Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australias very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Amanda Byram, and the Big Red Balls are back!

programme.desc: Its Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring Worlds Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as looking at the changes to his garden that have taken place over winter, Monty Don reveals how to plant bare-rooted raspberries in his renovated fruit garden and gets his secateurs out to rejuvenate an overgrown winter flowering honeysuckle. Plus, Monty recommends jobs for the weekend to ensure that all our seeds, seedlings and plants get off to the best possible start.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the official start of spring and Mothering Sunday only days away, Monty Don and the team look at the practical ways to achieve a better looking garden at this busy time of year. Monty is selecting and planting climbing roses at his garden in Herefordshire and gives plenty of advice on how to get them to thrive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the clocks move forward, the longer days of spring are welcomed by every gardener. It's a busy time in the garden and the longer daylight hours present a great opportunity to get on with larger gardening projects. Weather permitting, Joe will join Monty in his garden to get to grips with lining his newly created pond giving plenty of advice for anyone wanting to use water in the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing apace, Monty shows us how we can take advantage of the new growth of all sorts of perennials, and begins by taking cuttings from emerging Delphiniums in his border and also from a pot grown plant. He also demonstrates the best way of planting Clematis against a wall to ensure a profusion of summer flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's Easter and the biggest gardening weekend of the year. The team give plenty of advice and inspiration - from large projects to tackling weeds. At Longmeadow, Monty is getting started on the vegetable plot, where he recommends a palette of potatoes for delicious summer crops. He also returns to his newly created pond, where he is showing how to conceal the liner with an attractive edge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The successes and failures of all our gardens begin with the humble seed. This show is packed with know-how about how to sow a seed and ideas about how you could improve your garden this summer. Monty starts by sowing tender vegetables like cucumbers and courgettes which, from unpromising beginnings, will provide a fruitful summer. Plus, Carol gives a masterclass on successful seed sowing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: If you have a shady spot in your garden which is bereft of flowers, then Monty Don has some great suggestions of stalwarts which not only thrive in those tricky conditions, but return year after year. He is also working in the vegetable plot giving his tips on what to sow and plant out now. Meanwhile, Carol Klein discovers the pulmonaria, growing prolifically in the woodlands and verges of the New Forest.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With plenty of advice and tips on how and what to plant in a pond, Rachel de Thame joins Monty at Longmeadow to give a helping hand. Monty also gets up to date with all the seasonal jobs in the jewel garden. Meanwhile, Carol follows the trail of one of spring's brightest plants to an allotment in South Yorkshire and a man who has amassed a national collection of euphorbias there.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from the Malvern Spring Show where Monty Don, Carol Klein and Rachel De Thame bring the very best that the show has to offer. From planting and design in the show gardens, to new and exciting varieties in the floral marquee, they search out beautiful and innovative ideas to draw inspiration from.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Longmeadow with inspirational ideas and plants gathered at the Malvern Spring Show. He has tips and advice for planting bearded irises and then turns his attention to the pond where he shares ideas on different types of water lilies and how to plant them. Meanwhile, Carol Klein delves into the quirky world of ferns, discovering them in the wild and admiring their variety.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as looking at the changes to his garden that have taken place over winter, Monty Don reveals how to plant bare-rooted raspberries in his renovated fruit garden and gets his secateurs out to rejuvenate an overgrown winter flowering honeysuckle. Plus, Monty recommends jobs for the weekend to ensure that all our seeds, seedlings and plants get off to the best possible start.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Alis home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and thats exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the worlds best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Floridas coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the areas most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team showcases structural fiberglass repairs and teak refinishing on various project boats, including non-skid walkway applications.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex explore the SS United States; the worlds largest artificial reef.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and some good ol boys get a lesson in angling skills when the captain's wife takes them to school during a trip offshore.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: In our 100th episode we look back and detail a true labor of love. Discussing the fun and challenges learning and adapting to fishing & filming the amazing fishery surrounding Panama City Beach.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCBs white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson on an epic hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of New Zealand as he goes after Whitetail deer. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd have to borrow a trusty rifle from his guide, Shawn. Get ready for heart-pounding action, breathtaking scenery, and valuable tips and tricks from a seasoned hunter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in New Zealand, but this time, after a Wapiti. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide, Shawn. Elk were first introduced to New Zealand in 1909 when President Roosevelt gifted a herd of 20 animals that were released on the South Island. Get ready to immerse yourself in the beauty of nature that New Zealand has to offer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson sets his sights on a Free-Range New Zealand Red Stag, but it doesn't come easy. Dense fog, steep terrain, and thick vegetation make finding a mature stag no easy task. Watch as Mark Peterson and his guide cover the gorgeous New Zealand landscape in search of one of the most sought-after big game animals on the South Island of New Zealand. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP finds the Largemouth Bass keyed into only one specific pattern this mid fall day.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads back into Florida Bay with Captain Richard Black in search of Redfish, Snook and whatever else they run into using all artificial baits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Heads to the Dot Lawrence River to target Springtime Smallmouth Bass on small Swimbaits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Works with a BFS (Bait Finesse System) to cast micro crankbaits for pre-spawn Smallmouth Bass.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch hes helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed Buddy.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mindcatching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesnt take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After purchasing his very first Kansas farm, Shawn and his good friend Cole set out to transform it into a true whitetail paradise. Years of hard work, dedication, and habitat improvement finally pay off when Shawn takes on a challenge hes never faced beforeharvesting a whitetail buck on the ground with no blind! Filming adds another layer of difficulty, but the reward is more than worth it. In an unforgettable hunt, Shawn is able to harvest a giant 9.5-year-old Kansas buck, making this a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Captiva island is the land of giants. Snook, permit and tarpon are on todays agenda.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike fishes from safety harbor with Capt. Mikey Rogal for the coveted inshore slam.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to one of the most prolific fisheries in SW Florida; South Seas Island Resort.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the space coast for a mixed bag of drum.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA fishes the ultra shallow ponds in Flagler beach for reds and snook.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Tanner and CA put their power fishing skills to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to Jupiter to fish with Ryan Nitz for giant snook.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss and Captain James Hillman are heading out of Highland Park Fish Camp in Deland, Florida, looking for largemouth bass.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Its the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark Cheech Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff & Cole of Buckventures TV, are back in Oklahoma with one big goalcatching up with the buck they call That 170. With a cold front rolling in, they waste no time hanging stands and getting in position for the action. Jeff breaks out the WoodHaven Intimidator grunt call and sets the stage with a decoy, hoping to pull the giant into bow range.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten Scroggins and the whole family return to the blind to see if they can call one of the other gobblers back in to their setup. A family that hunts together stays together!

Tarif Alkhatibs is new to Team200, but no stranger to killing someof the biggest free range whitetails in his home state of Texas including the state record typical!

programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch hes helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed Buddy.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mindcatching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesnt take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After purchasing his very first Kansas farm, Shawn and his good friend Cole set out to transform it into a true whitetail paradise. Years of hard work, dedication, and habitat improvement finally pay off when Shawn takes on a challenge hes never faced beforeharvesting a whitetail buck on the ground with no blind! Filming adds another layer of difficulty, but the reward is more than worth it. In an unforgettable hunt, Shawn is able to harvest a giant 9.5-year-old Kansas buck, making this a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Its the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark Cheech Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way

programme.desc: A group of gay friends in Los Angeles share the ups and downs of relationships, careers, fatherhood, the deaths of friends, and new beginnings.

programme.title: Predestination
programme.desc: The final assignment for a retiring temporal agent is to stop the one criminal whos eluded him throughout time from committing mass murder in 1975.

programme.title: No Mercy
programme.desc: A Chicago cop looking to avenge the death of his partner heads to New Orleans and kidnaps the killer's mistress by handcuffing himself to her.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced theyre the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: A young schoolteacher turns into an outlaw to avenge her murdered father.

programme.title: A Man for All Seasons
programme.desc: From the Robert Bolt play.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: In 1830s London, orphan Oliver Twist escapes to join a band of young pickpockets led by the sly Fagin in this musical take on Dickens' classic tale.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Port Afrique
programme.desc: An American (Phil Carey) returns to Morocco and discovers his wife's past while probing her death.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friends marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: In this bittersweet, classic musical drama, the vibrant and beautiful young Fanny Brice (Barbra Streisand) starts out as a bit player on the New York City vaudeville stage, but works her way up to stardom on Broadway. Valued for her vocal and comedic talents by the renowned theater impresario Florenz Ziegfeld (Walter Pidgeon), Fanny thrives, but her relationship with her suave, imprisoned businessman husband, Nick Arnstein (Omar Sharif), is another story.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Cowboy Star
programme.desc: A disenchanted movie cowboy proves to be a genuine hero when he's forced to shoot it out with a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up

programme.title: The One
programme.desc: The guys wake up to learn that Ashley is nowhere to be found. Meanwhile, Brent is living his best life doing a steamy yoga session and connecting with the ladies. Eventually, Ashley returns but has some explaining to do before Eliminations.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Kadeem Hardison is best known for his iconic portrayal of Dwayne Wayne on the hit television show A Different World. Kadeem gets uncensored to talk about playing a beloved character on the show that influenced a generation.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Tyson Beckford is one of the first black male supermodels; Tyson breaks down his complex childhood that could've led him to prison, but led him to Ralph Lauren Instead.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Born to a 15-year-old single mom Tasha Smith moved to LA and worked on breaking in to stand up comedy. The urge to direct led Tasha to self-produce and direct her first short film, she has since moved on to episodic and feature length directing.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Born and raised in New York, Tami Roman and her mom fled to Los Angeles to escape Tamis childhood sexual and physical abuse. With the help of family and friends she was able to push through and is now a celebrated reality TV star and budding comic.

programme.title: Unsung
programme.desc: Unsung Presents Best In Black: Television features stories of pioneering TV shows, from The Jeffersons and A Different World to Insecure and In Living Color, that helped change the game, and change the world.

programme.title: Unsung
programme.desc: Unsung Presents Best in Black: Film Pioneers features portraits of pioneering figures in film, from Lena Horne and Sidney Poitier to Spike Lee and Ava DuVernay, who helped change the game, and change the world.

programme.title: White Water
programme.desc: White Water is the story of a 7 year-old black kid in segregated 1963 Opelika, Alabama who becomes obsessed with the desire to taste the water from the "white's only" drinking fountain and sets out on a quest to do the unthinkable: drink from it.

programme.title: The Rickey Smiley Show
programme.desc: Rickey has a stalker.

programme.title: The Rickey Smiley Show
programme.desc: Sister Bernice plans her own funeral when she thinks shes dying. Aunt Sylvia and Simone fight over an attractive man.

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: Elise joins the ladies on the cruise and has to defend herself from accusations of side deals. Paula feels a fracture in her friendship with Elise. The girls visit Jamaica. Golden hosts her own acting workshop but gets offended when Elise makes a comment about doing motherhood the right way.

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: Paula pushes Forrest to be more involved with group project. Things get out of control and tempers flare when the ladies confront Forrest without Paula. Countess gets an offer to sing on a documentary soundtrack. Golden and Elise try to find common ground after their fallout in Jamaica.

programme.title: The One
programme.desc: The house wakes up in a frenzy as the daters learn from Mieka that Brent shared his bed with one of the ladies. With the first elimination looming, will the recent events influence Brent and Ashleys decisions on who they send home?

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: Lisas throws a mothers brunch to celebrate her mom who has cancer. Paula revisits her homeless past. Countess starts working on her vocals again with Warryn Campell, while Golden puts her business hat on with her pillow line and photo shoot.

programme.desc: Will Downing is the Prince of Sophisticated Soul, with a 30-year career that includes chart topping singles in Dance, R&B, and Jazz. But at the height of his career, a paralyzing bout with auto-immune disease threatened his life.

programme.title: White Water
programme.desc: White Water is the story of a 7 year-old black kid in segregated 1963 Opelika, Alabama who becomes obsessed with the desire to taste the water from the "white's only" drinking fountain and sets out on a quest to do the unthinkable: drink from it.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Kirk Franklin was raised by his aunt. It was there that he discovered his love for music through the church. With the faith and support of his family he remains true to his spiritual journey and to inspire faith through his music and his testimony.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Hailing from Las Vegas, Nevada, Shaffer was raised by a single mother. Ne-Yo found out how important being a strong father figure would be. Taking opportunities as a songwriter he was able to build a career before landing a record deal.

programme.title: Unsung
programme.desc: Unsung Presents Best in Black: Fashion Icons features portraits of pioneering figures in fashion, from Run-D.M.C. and Grace Jones to Karl Kani and Virgil Abloh, who helped change the game, and change the world.

programme.title: Unsung
programme.desc: Featuring portraits of influential TV pioneers from Diahann Carroll and Nat King Cole to Arsenio Hall and RuPaul, who helped change the game, and change the world.

programme.title: Never Would Have Made It: Marvin Sapp Story
programme.desc: The story of Marvin Sapp, from his early years in Grand Rapids, Mich., to his career as a gospel singer and pastor.

programme.title: The Rickey Smiley Show
programme.desc: After a guest pastor gives a better sermon than Pastor E.L. Watkins, the church decides to replace him. Maurice has an unfortunate side effect when he takes a trial medication.

programme.title: The Rickey Smiley Show
programme.desc: Sister Bernice thinks Maurice has a crush on her. The women take a self-defense class.

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the ketchup bottle fight, Paula defends Forrest to the ladies at Lisas housewarming party. Things turn ugly when she and Rashaun argue. Golden begins seeing a new guy. Paula, Forrest, and Paulas mother go to family therapy with their pastor.

programme.title: Hollywood Divas
programme.desc: Lisas throws a mothers brunch to celebrate her mom who has cancer. Paula revisits her homeless past. Countess starts working on her vocals again with Warryn Campell, while Golden puts her business hat on with her pillow line and photo shoot.

programme.title: The One
programme.desc: The group compares their chemistry with Brent and Ashley as they take turns posing for an intimate high-end photoshoot. And a raunchy game night turns tense when Ashley gets offended, leaving the rest of the house annoyed by her reaction.

programme.title: The One
programme.desc: The mood in the house lightens when Kirk and Tammy host a very entertaining talent show. Ashley and Brent have intense one-on-one dates with all of their suitors, and struggle to decide which to send away from the Mansion.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Rapper Ja Rule dominated the charts under the notorious Murder Inc. Records label. He is uncensored about his journey from being a hustler in Queens to becoming a hip hop icon with a sound that defined an era.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Mario Van Peebles is the director behind the films "New Jack City" and "Posse"; he is inspired by his father's legacy, but he's getting uncensored to explain how he built his own legacy in Hollywood on his terms.
